net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.variables

Class Variable

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.Node
      • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.Value
        • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.Identifier
          • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.variables.Variable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrayAccess, Closure

    public class Variable
extends Identifier
    Identifier extension that represents the use of a variable type. Harnesses the needed information of each variable, such as whether or not it is constant, external, or an array, and its type.
    Since:
    v0.1 Jan 5, 2014 at 9:02:42 PM
    Version:
    v0.2.19 Jul 26, 2014 at 12:30:24 AM
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Variable clone(Node temporaryParent, Location locationIn)
      Return a new Node containing a copy of the values of the specified node, including clones of the children.

      Get the amount of dimensions that the array has, if any.

      Get whether or not the identifier is a value, pointer, or reference.

      Possible values include: Variable.VALUE - If the variable type simply refers to a value. Variable.POINTER - If the variable type is a pointer. Variable.REFERENCE - If the variable type is a reference.

      • isSameVariable

        public boolean isSameVariable(Variable other)
        Compare the specified variable with the given one to see if they come from the same declaration.
        Parameters:
        other - The variable to compare with.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the variables come from the same declaration.

      • isLocal

        public boolean isLocal()
        Get whether or not the specified Variable is a local variable. It is a local variable if it was declared inside a method. TODO: Can optimize to realize that if a parent is a method only node, stop there and return true.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the specified Variable is local.

        Parameters:

         int array[][][];

      • setType

        public boolean setType(java.lang.String type,
                       boolean require,
                       boolean checkType,
                       boolean checkExternal)
        Description copied from class: Value
        Set the type that this statement returns.

        For example: 
         private static int index;
        The type of the variable returns is "int"
        Specified by:
        setType in class Value
        Parameters:
        type - The type that this statement returns.
        require - Whether or not to throw an error if anything goes wrong.
        checkType - Whether or not to check if the type is valid.
        checkExternal - Whether or not to check the data type of the given type.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the type was set successfully.
        See Also:
        Value.setType(java.lang.String, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • getDataType

        public byte getDataType()
        Description copied from class: Value
        Get whether or not the identifier is a value, pointer, or reference.

        Possible values include:
        • Variable.VALUE - If the variable type simply refers to a value.
        • Variable.POINTER - If the variable type is a pointer.
        • Variable.REFERENCE - If the variable type is a reference.
        Specified by:
        getDataType in class Value
        Returns:
        The data type that the variable is.
        See Also:
        Value.getDataType()

      • test

        public static java.lang.String test()
        Test the Variable class type to make sure everything is working properly.
        Returns:
